Package com.intellij.openapi.options

Class BeanConfigurable<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intellij.openapi.options.BeanConfigurable<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConfigurableWithOptionDescriptors, UnnamedConfigurable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BaseCodeFoldingOptionsProvider, JavaCodeFoldingOptionsProvider, PythonFoldingOptionsProvider, XmlCodeFoldingOptionsProvider

    public abstract class BeanConfigurable<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements UnnamedConfigurable, ConfigurableWithOptionDescriptors
    See ConfigurableBuilder for UiDslConfigurable alternative.

      • checkBox

        protected void checkBox(java.lang.String title,
                        Getter<java.lang.Boolean> getter,
                        Setter<java.lang.Boolean> setter)
        Adds check box with given title. Initial checkbox value is obtained from getter. After the apply, the value from the check box is written back to model via setter.

      • checkBox

        protected void checkBox(java.lang.String title,
                        <any> prop)

      • component

        protected <V> void component(javax.swing.JComponent component,
                             Getter<? extends V> beanGetter,
                             Setter<? super V> beanSetter,
                             Getter<? extends V> componentGetter,
                             Setter<? super V> componentSetter)
        Adds custom component (e.g. edit box). Initial value is obtained from beanGetter and applied to the component via componentSetter. E.g. text is read from the model and set to the edit box. After the apply, the value from the component is queried via componentGetter and written back to model via beanSetter. E.g. text from the edit box is queried and saved back to model bean.

      • getOptionDescriptors

        public java.util.List<OptionDescription> getOptionDescriptors(java.lang.String configurableId,
                                                              java.util.function.Function<? super java.lang.String,java.lang.String> nameConverter)
        Specified by:
        getOptionDescriptors in interface ConfigurableWithOptionDescriptors

      • createComponent

        public javax.swing.JComponent createComponent()
        Description copied from interface: UnnamedConfigurable
        Creates new Swing form that enables user to configure the settings. Usually this method is called on the EDT, so it should not take a long time.

        Also this place is designed to allocate resources (subscriptions/listeners etc.)

        Specified by:
        createComponent in interface UnnamedConfigurable
        Returns:
        new Swing form to show, or null if it cannot be created
        See Also:
        UnnamedConfigurable.disposeUIResources()

      • isModified

        public boolean isModified()
        Description copied from interface: UnnamedConfigurable
        Indicates whether the Swing form was modified or not. This method is called very often, so it should not take a long time.
        Specified by:
        isModified in interface UnnamedConfigurable
        Returns:
        true if the settings were modified, false otherwise

      • apply

        public void apply()
           throws ConfigurationException
        Description copied from interface: UnnamedConfigurable
        Stores the settings from the Swing form to the configurable component. This method is called on EDT upon user's request.
        Specified by:
        apply in interface UnnamedConfigurable
        Throws:
        ConfigurationException - if values cannot be applied

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Description copied from interface: UnnamedConfigurable
        Loads the settings from the configurable component to the Swing form. This method is called on EDT immediately after the form creation or later upon user's request.
        Specified by:
        reset in interface UnnamedConfigurable
